conclusion: Analyze the initial state with four objects and their shadows.
The shadows are cast behind and generally to the left of the objects.
Current light source is located in front of and to the right of the objects, and above them.
Understand the new position of the light source as moving to the back left above the objects.
New light source position is behind and to the left of the objects, and still above them.
Shadows are formed when objects block light and are cast in the direction opposite to the light source.
In the initial setup, shadows are cast in the back left; in the new setup, shadows will be cast in the front right.
Shadows will move from being in the back left of the objects to being in the front right of the objects.
Shadow A will move to the front right of the paper.
Shadow B will move to the front right of the mirror.
Shadow C will move to the front right of the ring.
Shadow D will move to the front right of the avocado.
All shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the bottom right in the image, relative to their respective objects.
Final answer: All shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the front right of their respective objects.
